text: The Depretis I Cabinet held office from 25 March 1876 until 25 December 1877, a total of 650 days, or 1 year and 9 months.L'Italia sotto il governo Depretis ==Government parties== The government was composed by the following parties: {| class=wikitable style="font-size:100%" |- !colspan=2|Party !Ideology !Leader |- | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | Liberalism | Agostino Depretis |} ==Composition== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 100%;" |- ! Minister of the Interior | Giovanni Nicotera | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of Foreign Affairs | Luigi Amedeo Melegari | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of Grace and Justice | Pasquale Stanislao Mancini | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of Finance | Agostino Depretis | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of War | Luigi Mezzacapo | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of the Navy | Benedetto Brin | bgcolor="" | | Military | (1876–1877) |- ! Minister of Agriculture, Industry and Commerce | Salvatore Majorana Calatabiano | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- ! rowspan=2|Minister of Public Works | Giuseppe Zanardelli | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1876–1877) |- | Agostino Depretis | bgcolor="" | | Historical Left | (1877–1877) |- !
